alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 2:54PM MST until June 24 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona in Yavapai County including Dewey-Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 PM MST, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Winters Wash, Cienega Creek, Osborne Spring Wash, Ash Creek, Dry Creek, Cherry Creek, Hackberry Wash, Coyote Wash, Chaparral Gulch, Racetrack Wash, Lynx Creek, Yarber Wash, Brushy Wash and Little Hackberry Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt and Powell Springs Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 278 and 285. Interstate 17 between mile markers 269 and 270. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
